channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are EV Chargers the Next Rent-Increasing Amenity?
item.description: Electric vehicle sales are rising. Does it make sense to add an EV charging station at your property, and can you raise rent accordingly?

item.title: The tech world mourns Susan Wojcicki
item.description: Susan Wojcicki, a longtime Googler who spent nearly a decade as the CEO of YouTube, passed away Friday after a two-year battle with non-small cell lung cancer. Wojcicki, who was 56, famously rented the garage of her Menlo Park home to Larry Page and Sergey Brin as they were starting Google. She then became one […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ‘Deliberate Indifference’: Court Rulings Challenge Extreme Heat Conditions in Prisons
item.description: “If it’s 103 outside, it may be 107 to -8 inside of your cell,” said a man who worked in the fields while imprisoned in Texas.

item.title: Signs That You May Be Dehydrated
item.description: When you lose more water than you take in, your body struggles to perform its essential tasks. Learn how to tell if you're not getting enough water to avoid dehydration.

item.title: How the Financial Policies of Trump and Harris Could Impact Real Estate Investors
item.description: With the election just three months away, it's important to take a look at how each candidate's policies would impact the economy and, ultimately, investors.

item.title: As Alexa turns 10, Amazon looks to generative AI
item.description: While Amazon has continued releasing Echo devices, including an upgraded Spot announced last month, the company has taken its foot off the gas. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Tim Walz on Criminal Justice: 5 Things to Know
item.description: Where Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, Vice President Kamala Harris’ running mate, stands on policing, guns, prison reform and other issues.

item.title: Breaking Up with Your Property Manager: When and How to Make the Switch
item.description: Identify the red flags in property management and take action when your provider does not meet your expectations.

item.title: Redfin CEO promises to ‘drink our own urine’ if mortgage rates don’t fall
item.description: He really said that: When asked about the company’s “Plan B” if mortgage rates don’t fall, Redfin CEO Glenn Kelman responded, “Plan B is to drink our own urine or our competitors’ blood, stay in the foxhole.” This wasn’t at some informal, off-the-record gathering. It was on Redfin’s second quarter earnings call, the kind of […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.

item.title: What to Do About Cholesterol Issues
BiggerNews: 2024 Housing Market Update (Home Prices, Mortgage Rate Predictions)
item.description: Where will the housing market be by 2025? We’ve got some of the top 2024 housing market predictions to share today as we run through what could happen with home […]

item.title: Turkey restores access to Instagram
item.description: Turkey appears to have restored access to Meta-owned Instagram, after blocking the app on August 2. Abdulkadir Uraloglu, the country’s minister of transport and infrastructure, posted today that the ban would be lifted at 9:30pm Turkish time. Cybersecurity monitor NetBlocks says, “Live metrics show that Instagram is being gradually restored on internet providers in #Turkey […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: Rookie Reply: How to Screen Tenants for Free & When to Cash-Out Refinance
item.description: Screening tenants is a necessary but expensive part of real estate investing. In some cases, property managers charge as much as one month’s rent to place a tenant. What if […]

item.title: Tesla’s Dojo, a timeline
item.description: Elon Musk doesn’t want Tesla to be just an automaker. He wants Tesla to be an AI company, one that’s figured out how to make cars drive themselves. Crucial to that mission is Dojo, Tesla’s custom-built supercomputer designed to train its Full Self-Driving (FSD) neural networks. FSD isn’t actually fully self-driving; it can perform some […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.
